title: [FR] Log an array of metrics in one call.

labels.name: area/tracking
labels.description: Tracking service, tracking client APIs, autologging

body:
## Willingness to contribute
The MLflow Community encourages new feature contributions. Would you or another member of your organization be willing to contribute an implementation of this feature (either as an MLflow Plugin or an enhancement to the MLflow code base)?

- [X] Yes. I can contribute this feature independently.
- [ ] Yes. I would be willing to contribute this feature with guidance from the MLflow community.
- [ ] No. I cannot contribute this feature at this time.

## Proposal Summary

In the mlflow package, implemnt a `log_array_metric(name, array)` function. It will be equivalent to:
```
for i, val in enumerate(array):
     mlflow.log_metric(name, val, step=i) 
```
The implementation should rely on the log_batch function of MlflowClient object in order to reduce the number of calls to the mlflow server

## Motivation

It is a common use case to log a loss after a training. Currently, it is necessary to write the loop. This FR would remove some boiler plate code.
The loop generates N remote calls to the mlflow server (N = size of the array). For my personal use-case, logging 1000 points takes 90 s. If I use log_batch method from the mflowclient, it takes 4s.
